### Page Title/Heading
Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

### Main Body Text (Top Section)
On all exterior floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

### Subsections and Bullet Points
In Fig. below, the highlighted areas count as follows:

• Area A: 3rd Floor area, but at least 5' head

• Area B: controlled in count of the floor, area, attic, 3rd floor.

Volumetric spaces in structure continue to the mass areas if these areas are used

Floor Plan & The 2nd Floor area

2nd floor equivalency areas count toward the gross floor area.

### Diagram (Fig. 13)
- The diagram is a cross-sectional illustration of a building (appearing as a house with a pitched roof).
- It includes a triangular roof structure with internal divisions.
- Labeled elements:
  - "A" (pointing to an upper area under the roof peak).
  - "B" (pointing to a lower area near the floor level).
- Additional labels within the diagram:
  - "3rd floor" (near the base).
  - "2nd floor" (below the main structure).
  - A staircase is depicted leading upward.
  - Arrows or lines indicate measurements or clearances (e.g., from floor to roof).
- Caption below the diagram: Fig. 13 Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

### Notes (Bottom Section)
Note: 550 sf of unusable attic may be exempted for Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Note: One top of floor to underside of roof rafter. Unfinished attic.
